page.title: 01COUSLAND AND ENVIRONS
page.content: THIS IS AN AGRICULTURAL AREA OF ARABLE AND LIVESTOCK FARMING. THE VILLAGE OF COUSLAND IS THE LARGEST SETTLEMENT, NOW MAINLY A COMMUTER VILLAGE FOR EDINBURGH. THERE IS A SCHOOL OF THIRTY SIX PUPILS, A PLAYGROUP FOR 3 - 5 YEAR OLDS. SEVERAL CRAFTSMEN LIVE AND WORK IN THE AREA - ARTIST, POTTER, BLACKSMITH. A VILLAGE GALA DAY, WITH COMPETITIONS, STALLS AND DANCING IS HELD ON A SATURDAY IN JUNE. VILLAGERS JOIN IN THE SCHOOL'S CELEBRATION OF IMPORTANT FESTIVALS. THE AREA HAS A VARIETY OF HOUSE TYPES - FARMHOUSES, CONVERTED COTTAGES, COUNCIL HOUSING AND A SMALL NEW ESTATE. TRANSPORT IS MAINLY BY CARS, WITH DAILY BUS SERVICES TO NEARBY TOWNS. THERE IS NO RAILWAY.
